channel.title: Slimmed Down GitHub YAML Updates
channel.description: A feed of updated YAML files from GitHub

item.title: November 2025: New Rules
item.description:
New rules:
Name: Azure Key Vault access TimeSeries anomaly (1.0.6)
ID: 0914adab-90b5-47a3-a79f-7cdcac843aa7

Name: Azure RBAC (Elevate Access) (1.0.0)
ID: 132fdff4-c044-4855-a390-c1b71e0f833b

Name: Exchange AuditLog Disabled (2.0.6)
ID: 194dd92e-d6e7-4249-85a5-273350a7f5ce

Name: Exchange workflow MailItemsAccessed operation anomaly (2.0.6)
ID: b4ceb583-4c44-4555-8ecf-39f572e827ba

Name: External guest invitation followed by Microsoft Entra ID PowerShell signin (1.0.3)
ID: acc4c247-aaf7-494b-b5da-17f18863878a

Name: full_access_as_app Granted To Application (1.0.2)
ID: 54e22fed-0ec6-4fb2-8312-2a3809a93f63

Name: Mail redirect via ExO transport rule (2.0.4)
ID: 500415fb-bba7-4227-a08a-9857fb61b6a7

Name: Mail.Read Permissions Granted to Application (1.0.4)
ID: 2560515c-07d1-434e-87fb-ebe3af267760

Name: Malicious Inbox Rule (2.0.4)
ID: 7b907bf7-77d4-41d0-a208-5643ff75bf9a

Name: Microsoft Entra ID Hybrid Health AD FS Service Delete (2.0.3)
ID: 86a036b2-3686-42eb-b417-909fc0867771

Name: Ngrok Reverse Proxy on Network (ASIM DNS Solution) (1.0.0)
ID: 50b0dfb7-2c94-4eaf-a332-a5936d78c263

Name: Multiple users email forwarded to same destination (2.0.3)
ID: 871ba14c-88ef-48aa-ad38-810f26760ca3

Name: Microsoft Entra ID PowerShell accessing non-Entra ID resources (1.0.4)
ID: 50574fac-f8d1-4395-81c7-78a463ff0c52

Name: Multiple admin membership removals from newly created admin. (1.0.3)
ID: cda5928c-2c1e-4575-9dfa-07568bc27a4f

Name: Office Policy Tampering (2.0.3)
ID: fbd72eb8-087e-466b-bd54-1ca6ea08c6d3

Name: SharePointFileOperation via previously unseen IPs (2.0.4)
ID: 4b11568b-3f5f-4ba1-80c8-7f1dc8390eb7

Name: Subscription moved to another tenant (1.0.1)
ID: 48c026d8-7f36-4a95-9568-6f1420d66e37

Name: Suspicious application consent similar to PwnAuth (1.0.2)
ID: 39198934-62a0-4781-8416-a81265c03fd6

Name: TI map Domain entity to Dns Events (ASIM DNS Schema) (1.2.3)
ID: 7c1ea2e6-6210-412c-92e4-180803a741b4

Name: Suspicious granting of permissions to an account (2.0.2)
ID: b2c15736-b9eb-4dae-8b02-3016b6a45a32

Name: Suspicious application consent similar to O365 Attack Toolkit (1.1.2)
ID: f948a32f-226c-4116-bddd-d95e91d97eb9

Name: TI map IP entity to DNS Events (ASIM DNS schema) (1.2.10)
ID: b306fba8-1a28-449f-aa24-30362e16d4f5
